column4: if I need a Java plugin for Firefox, I just need to install "icedtea-plugin" and its dependencies right?
I just get this "Downloading..." window with nothing in it and the standard Java unsigned applet warning
which is fine, but I can't click in the warning window because the "Downloading..." window is "in front of" it
ok, first you have to get the public key to the server...is that already done?
Sometimes that happens with code meant for "official java".  I've noticed that a fair amount with things that never get updated, like java on print-servers, crappy routers, etc.
it's not even getting that far though

I've got some dells with a remote java-console.  If I used openjdk or 64bit oracle-jdk, I get a downloading screen that doesn't move for 10 minutes, then it will magically connect, or just die.  You mean in the applet right?
Also, minimize your browser window, sometimes the allow-applet screens get hidden.
Oh wow.  32bit official always works, openjdk/icedtea half the time..  It always works if I connect froma  mac, if that helps.
Of course it can't do cdrom/iso redirection from apples.  Thanks dell.
I've got two chassis full of C5125s, and they're ALL like this.
This is going to sound so lame.  32 windows xp in virtualbox.
I think it's a java-web-start, so it actually downloads all the peices via an applet, before launching it in a less-restrivtive sandbox than an applet has.
thing is, though, if I just run "javaws <uri>" at the console, I don't get that error
You can run that against the file it grabs.  Sometimes it works.
